column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.3
#T_SP=webanno.custom.RoleAnnotation|roles
#Text=Mr.
#Text=Gata Mavita wa Lufuta (Democratic Republic of the Congo) (spoke in French): First of all, I\r
#Text=would like to thank France for organizing this debate.
#Text=I also commend Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon\r
#Text=and his Special Representative Zainab Bangura, as\r
#Text=well as all those who spoke before me, for their very\r
#Text=useful presentations.
#Text=Sexual violence in conflict situations is a scourge\r
#Text=from which my country, the Democratic Republic of\r
#Text=the Congo, has long suffered.
#Text=For more than a decade,\r
#Text=my country has experienced especially bloody armed\r
#Text=conflicts in the eastern part of its territory.
#Text=Those\r
#Text=conflicts, which have caused many human casualties,\r
#Text=are at the source ofthe practice ofusing rape as a weapon\r
#Text=of war.
#Text=The lives of thousands of girls, women, boys\r
#Text=and men have thus been disrupted.
#Text=The consequences\r
#Text=of the situation psychologically, economically and in\r
#Text=medical terms are enormous.
#Text=This debate affords us an opportunity to once again\r
#Text=touch on the efforts of my country's Government to\r
#Text=combat this situation.
#Text=The restoration of peace in the\r
#Text=part of the country formerly occupied by rebel armed\r
#Text=groups has brought major change.
#Text=Enormous progress\r
#Text=has been made both in the fight against sexual violence\r
#Text=and at the level of responding to the needs of victims.
#Text=In referring to my country, the report (S/2016/36l) of\r
#Text=the Secretary-General attests to that in mentioning\r
#Text=the appreciable 80 per cent decline in the number of\r
#Text=cases of sexual violence in conflict areas.
#Text=Among other\r
#Text=things, my Government attributes those results to the\r
#Text=following elements: the appointment of a personal\r
#Text=representative of the President of the Republic in charge\r
#Text=of the fight against sexual violence and the recruitment\r
#Text=of children; the adoption of a plan of action to combat\r
#Text=sexual violence among the armed forces and the\r
#Text=signing ofajoint communique on the issue between the\r
#Text=Government and the United Nations; the adoption of a\r
#Text=zero-tolerance policy; and the signing by the Minister\r
#Text=of National Defence of a decree on the responsibility\r
#Text=of the unit commanders of the Forces armees de la\r
#Text=Republique democratique du Congo for combating\r
#Text=sexual violence.
#Text=All of those steps reflect the will of the Government\r
#Text=to end this scourge and honour its international\r
#Text=commitments.
#Text=Against that backdrop, the Government\r
#Text=is committed to addressing the various problems,\r
#Text=including deliveringjustice in the fight against impunity.
#Text=In that connection, 111 cases were decided in 2015 by\r
#Text=the military justice system, without regard for the rank\r
#Text=ofthe accused.
#Text=We have also established a compensation\r
#Text=fund, while two Senate committees, on sexual violence\r
#Text=and on political, administrative and judicial issues, are\r
#Text=\r
#Text=working on a bill proposed by the office of the personal\r
#Text=representative of the Head of State.
#Text=On preventing\r
#Text=sexual violence, a regional campaign called "Breaking\r
#Text=the Silence" will be launched by September.
#Text=On\r
#Text=socioeconomic reintegration, with the collaboration of\r
#Text=our national institute for professional training, training\r
#Text=was organized at Kibumba last September in various\r
#Text=economic sectors for survivors and demobilized\r
#Text=fighters.
#Text=That type of training will continue this year\r
#Text=in Rutshuru in North Kivu and in Bunia and Aru in\r
#Text=Ituri and will train 2,000 people.
#Text=A $35,000 credit fund\r
#Text=was set up to meet the financial needs of some women\r
#Text=in Bunia.
#Text=That progress has been made possible thanks\r
#Text=to the Government's own resources, with the technical\r
#Text=support of the international community, including\r
#Text=assistance from Japan via Ms.
#Text=Bangura's office,\r
#Text=and the United Nations Population Fund and various\r
#Text=other partners.
#Text=In conclusion, my country is determined to continue\r
#Text=its efforts to completely eradicate sexual violence.
#Text=We\r
#Text=highly value the support provided to us in that regard\r
#Text=by the United Nations and the international community.
